posts.post_content:
My main problem with the card, besides the unnecessary break from tradition, is its incongruous flavor.   
  
Vanilla creatures should have vanilla names. Creatures with non-vanilla names should have corresponding abilities.   
  
Grizzly Bears was a vanilla creature. What does Runeclaw Bear do that's different from the Grizzlies? Nothing.   
  
There's a trading card game I've heard of where creatures have grandiose names without matching abilities. A card could be called "Doma the Angel of Silence," or "Sorcerer of the Doomed," for example, and be entirely vanilla. That would be Yu Gi Oh. Let's not go in that direction, please.  
  
So how could you design a Runeclaw Bear that makes sense? Let's think about card design for a moment.  
  
Runes suggest objects that have been inscribed with spells to grant them magical powers. What are magical objects? Artifacts. Enchantments. Claws suggest that he could destroy said objects. So we have "destroy target artifact or enchantment".   
  
Now there was a 2/2 crea... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

So how could you design a Runeclaw Bear that makes sense? Let's think about card design for a moment.

Runes suggest objects that have been inscribed with spells to grant them magical powers. What are magical objects? Artifacts. Enchantments. Claws suggest that he could destroy said objects. So we have "destroy target artifact or enchantment".

posts.post_content:
Hallelujah! My prayers have been answered!  
[Runeclaw Bear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Runeclaw Bear) makes his triumphant return and what a return it is! I spent many sleepless nights over the past year worrying that some idiot at WOTC would decide that [Runeclaw Bear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Runeclaw Bear) was too powerful and that it would not see reprint. Now my night terrors are over. I will be able to sleep soundly at night, knowing that If a burglar breaks into my house and challenges me to a game of Magic (Standard format of course), I can summon the might fury of [Runeclaw Bear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Runeclaw Bear) to rip him apart 2 damage at a time.   
  
Who honestly cares about some of the other returning M 10 cards;  
[Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt )  Lame.  
[Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel )  sideboard at best.  
all other cards fall short of [Runeclaw Bear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Runeclaw Bear)s Glory  
  
Still doubting [Runeclaw Bear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Runeclaw Bear)? try comboing it with [Bear Umbra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bear Umbra) and watch your opponent's eyes bleed as their br... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Khavrion (6/30/2011 9:33:57 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Peve O, you get points in my book for giving me a mental image of Russian Stacking Bears. I'm not sure what you can spend those points on. Dexterity, perhaps?
  
   
Well, the bear is back. No surprises there, but I do find it odd that some of the other recently re-tooled cards in M10 didn't make it into the set, where this did. It seems equally absurd in this set, actually, next to cards like [Garruk's Companion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk's Companion), which can serve equally well as a new player tutoring aid due to it's flavour tie-in and simplistic nature.
  
   
The inclusion of the bears (sorry, bear) really isn't upsetting without the preview fake-out of last year. The real problem I have is that I can't see Popeye Bear here as being nearly as iconic as his Grizzly counterpart. So that just begs the question- why is he here?
posts.html:
Peve O, you get points in my book for giving me a mental image of Russian Stacking Bears. I'm not sure what you can spend those points on. Dexterity, perhaps?

Well, the bear is back. No surprises there, but I do find it odd that some of the other recently re-tooled cards in M10 didn't make it into the set, where this did. It seems equally absurd in this set, actually, next to cards like Garruk's Companion, which can serve equally well as a new player tutoring aid due to it's flavour tie-in and simplistic nature.

The inclusion of the bears (sorry, bear) really isn't upsetting without the preview fake-out of last year. The real problem I have is that I can't see Popeye Bear here as being nearly as iconic as his Grizzly counterpart. So that just begs the question- why is he here?

[Grizzly Bears](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grizzly Bears)  
[Balduvian Bears](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Balduvian Bears)  
[Bear Cub](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bear Cub)  
[Forest Bear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Forest Bear)  
You may only put 20 bears in a legacy legal deck. To fill slots add [Werebear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Werebear) and [Caller of the Claw](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Caller of the Claw)
